alert.note: Alert for Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:24PM CDT until June 17 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CRENSHAW AND NORTHEASTERN COVINGTON COUNTIES... At 324 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Dozier, or 10 miles west of Elba, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Crenshaw and northeastern Covington Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
